column2: Formulate an ontology related to case. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .@prefix : <http://example.org/case#> .:Case a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A container for storing or transporting goods, materials, or objects." .:LegalCase a owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Case ;    rdfs:label "Legal Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A dispute between parties to be resolved in a court of law." .:ContainerCase a owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Case ;    rdfs:label "Container Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A physical object used to store or transport items." .:CriminalCase a owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :LegalCase ;    rdfs:label "Criminal Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A case involving a person charged with a crime." .:CivilCase a owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :LegalCase ;    rdfs:label "Civil Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A case between private parties over a legal disagreement." .:handles a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :LegalCase ;    rdfs:range :Lawyer ;    rdfs:label "handles" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to the lawyer handling it." .:Lawyer a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Lawyer" ;    rdfs:comment "A person who practices or studies law." .:hasVerdict a owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :LegalCase ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:label "has verdict" ;    rdfs:comment "The final decision in a legal case." .:hasItem a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :ContainerCase ;    rdfs:range :Item ;    rdfs:label "has item" ;    rdfs:comment "Associates a container case with an item inside it." .:Item a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Item" ;    rdfs:comment "An object contained within a container case." .```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: case. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.org/ontology#> .ex:Case rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A general concept representing a case, which can be of various types." .ex:LegalCase rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Legal Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A legal proceeding, including civil or criminal cases." ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case .ex:MedicalCase rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Medical Case" ;    rdfs:comment "An instance of a person receiving medical attention or treatment." ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case .ex:UseCase rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Use Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A description of a systemâ€™s behavior in response to external inputs." ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case .ex:CaseID rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:label "Case ID" ;    rdfs:comment "A unique identifier for a case." ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range rdf:Literal .ex:hasOutcome rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has Outcome" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to its outcome." ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range ex:Outcome .ex:Outcome rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Outcome" ;    rdfs:comment "Represents the result or conclusion of a case." .ex:hasParticipant rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has Participant" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to its participants." ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range ex:Participant .ex:Participant rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Participant" ;    rdfs:comment "A person or entity involved in a case." .ex:startDate rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:label "Start Date" ;    rdfs:comment "The date when a case began." ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#date> .ex:endDate rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:label "End Date" ;    rdfs:comment "The date when a case concluded." ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#date> .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: case.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/case#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .:Case rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A general concept representing a case or instance." .:LegalCase rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Case ;    rdfs:label "Legal Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A case in the context of the legal system." .:MedicalCase rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Case ;    rdfs:label "Medical Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A case in the context of the medical field." .:CaseStatus rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case Status" ;    rdfs:comment "Represents the status of a case." .:open rdf:type :CaseStatus ;    rdfs:label "Open" ;    rdfs:comment "The case is currently open." .:closed rdf:type :CaseStatus ;    rdfs:label "Closed" ;    rdfs:comment "The case is closed." .:isAbout rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range owl:Thing ;    rdfs:label "is about" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates what the case is about." .:hasStatus rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range :CaseStatus ;    rdfs:label "has status" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the current status of the case." .:CaseNumber rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:label "case number" ;    rdfs:comment "An identifier number for the case." .```

column2: Formulate an ontology related to case. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```ttl@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.org/case#> .ex:Case a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A general concept for grouping related information" .ex:LegalCase a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Legal Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A case that involves a legal matter" ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case .ex:MedicalCase a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Medical Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A case that involves a medical condition or treatment" ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case .ex:CaseID a owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:label "Case ID" ;    rdfs:comment "A unique identifier for a case" ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range xsd:string .ex:hasParticipant a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has Participant" ;    rdfs:comment "Associates a case with a participant involved in it" ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range ex:Participant .ex:Participant a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Participant" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity involved in a case" .ex:Judge a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Judge" ;    rdfs:comment "A participant who presides over a legal case" ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Participant .ex:Doctor a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Doctor" ;    rdfs:comment "A participant who is a medical professional in a medical case" ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Participant .ex:Location a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Location" ;    rdfs:comment "The place where the case is held or relevant" .ex:occurredAt a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "occurred At" ;    rdfs:comment "Associates a case with its location" ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range ex:Location .```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: case. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix ex: <http://example.org/case#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .ex:Case a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A situation, example or legal matter to be considered or acted upon." .ex:LegalCase a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case ;    rdfs:label "Legal Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A legal proceeding or matter that involves a court of law." .ex:UsageCase a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case ;    rdfs:label "Usage Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A scenario involving the use or application of something." .ex:MedicalCase a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case ;    rdfs:label "Medical Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A set of circumstances or a particular instance of a disease or condition." .ex:CaseStatus a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case Status" ;    rdfs:comment "The current state or condition of a case." .ex:isPartOf a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range ex:Case ;    rdfs:label "is part of" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a case is part of another case." .ex:hasStatus a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range ex:CaseStatus ;    rdfs:label "has status" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the current status of a case." .ex:Open a ex:CaseStatus ;    rdfs:label "Open" ;    rdfs:comment "A case that is currently active and has not yet been resolved or closed." .ex:Closed a ex:CaseStatus ;    rdfs:label "Closed" ;    rdfs:comment "A case that has been resolved or finished." .ex:Plaintiff a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:LegalCase ;    rdfs:range rdf:Resource ;    rdfs:label "plaintiff" ;    rdfs:comment "The individual or party who initiates a lawsuit." .ex:Defendant a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:LegalCase ;    rdfs:range rdf:Resource ;    rdfs:label "defendant" ;    rdfs:comment "The individual or party against whom a lawsuit is brought." .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: case.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix ex: <http://example.org/ontology#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .ex:Case rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A class representing a case, which could be a legal case, an instance of an occurrence, etc."ex:hasCaseNumber rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:label "has case number" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to its unique case number." .ex:isCaseOf rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range ex:Subject ;    rdfs:label "is case of" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to the subject it pertains to." .ex:hasStatus rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range ex:Status ;    rdfs:label "has status" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to its current status." .ex:Subject rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Subject" ;    rdfs:comment "A class representing the subject matter or the context of a case."ex:Status rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Status" ;    rdfs:comment "A class representing the status of a case, such as open, closed, pending, etc."ex:CaseType rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "CaseType" ;    rdfs:comment "A class representing different types of cases, such as LegalCase, MedicalCase, etc."ex:hasType rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ex:Case ;    rdfs:range ex:CaseType ;    rdfs:label "has type" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to its type." .```

column2: Formulate an ontology related to case. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.org/ontology#> .ex:Case rdf:type owl:Class ;        rdfs:label "Case" ;        rdfs:comment "A general concept representing a legal case or instance." .ex:LegalCase rdf:type owl:Class ;             rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case ;             rdfs:label "Legal Case" ;             rdfs:comment "A case that involves legal proceedings." .ex:MedicalCase rdf:type owl:Class ;               rdfs:subClassOf ex:Case ;               rdfs:label "Medical Case" ;               rdfs:comment "A case involving a medical patient or situation." .ex:CaseStatus rdf:type owl:Class ;              rdfs:label "Case Status" ;              rdfs:comment "The status of a case indicating its progress or resolution." .ex:hasStatus rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;             rdfs:domain ex:Case ;             rdfs:range ex:CaseStatus ;             rdfs:label "has status" ;             rdfs:comment "Relates a case to its status." .ex:hasDate rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;           rdfs:domain ex:Case ;           rdfs:range <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#date> ;           rdfs:label "has date" ;           rdfs:comment "The date associated with a particular case." .ex:involvesParty rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;                 rdfs:domain ex:Case ;                 rdfs:range ex:Party ;                 rdfs:label "involves party" ;                 rdfs:comment "Relates a case to the parties involved." .ex:Party rdf:type owl:Class ;         rdfs:label "Party" ;         rdfs:comment "A participant involved in a case." .ex:OpenStatus rdf:type owl:NamedIndividual, ex:CaseStatus ;              rdfs:label "Open Status" ;              rdfs:comment "Indicates that the case is currently open." .ex:ClosedStatus rdf:type owl:NamedIndividual, ex:CaseStatus ;                rdfs:label "Closed Status" ;                rdfs:comment "Indicates that the case is closed or resolved." .```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: case. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .:Case a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A general concept representing an instance or occurrence of a subject under investigation or study." .:LegalCase a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Case ;    rdfs:label "Legal Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A case in a court of law." .:MedicalCase a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Case ;    rdfs:label "Medical Case" ;    rdfs:comment "An instance of a disease or disorder being treated or described." .:UseCase a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Case ;    rdfs:label "Use Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A scenario in which a system is used to achieve a specific goal." .:caseNumber a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:label "Case Number" ;    rdfs:comment "The unique identifier for a specific case." .:caseTitle a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:label "Case Title" ;    rdfs:comment "The title or name of the case." .:caseDescription a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:label "Case Description" ;    rdfs:comment "A detailed description of the case." .:involvesParty a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range :Party ;    rdfs:label "Involves Party" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to the parties involved." .:Party a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Party" ;    rdfs:comment "An individual or entity involved in a case." .:hasOutcome a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :LegalCase ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:label "Has Outcome" ;    rdfs:comment "The outcome or result of a legal case." .:diagnosis a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :MedicalCase ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:label "Diagnosis" ;    rdfs:comment "The identified condition in a medical case." .:systemFunctionality a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :UseCase ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:label "System Functionality" ;    rdfs:comment "The functionality a system provides to achieve the use case goal." .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: case.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .:Case rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case" ;    rdfs:comment "A general class to represent a 'case', which can have various attributes and relations." .:hasStatus rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range :Status ;    rdfs:label "has status" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to its current status." .:Status rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Status" ;    rdfs:comment "Represents the status of a case, such as open, closed, or pending." .:hasDate rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range xsd:dateTime ;    rdfs:label "has date" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to a specific date or timestamps." .:involvesPerson rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range :Person ;    rdfs:label "involves person" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a case to a person involved in it." .:Person rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Person" ;    rdfs:comment "A class representing a person involved in the case." .:CaseType rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Case Type" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the type of case, such as legal, medical, or other." .:hasCaseType rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range :CaseType ;    rdfs:label "has case type" ;    rdfs:comment "Specifies the type of the case." .:isRelatedTo rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Case ;    rdfs:range :Case ;    rdfs:label "is related to" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates one case to another case, indicating some form of relationship." .```
